title: UK Stoplight Demo
description: A simple stoplight survey example with default values for UK.

title.es: Please enter your selected personal reference

enumNames: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
Virgin Islands of the United States of America

title.es: Please enter the area you live in
Please enter the currency in which you earn your main income
What is your primary economic activity?
Please estimate your gross monthly household income (i.e, before taxes National Insurance contributions or other deductions)
How many people are in your household?
How many people in your household have an income?
How many people under 18 live in your household?
Do you receive any state income. (e.g. allowances, benefits, disability, pension)?
What is your highest educational level?
What is your highest educational level in your household
What is the property title situation of your household?
Is there any member with disabilities in your household? Please indicate the disability type
Please select the geographic location of your household

enum.description: Our household income is always above 60% of the UK average, i.e., Single: £9,500, couple with no kids: £14,200, couple with two kids: £20,400.
Our household income, this year, is above 60% of the UK average, i.e., Single: £9,500, couple with no kids: £14,200, couple with two kids: £20,400.
Our household income is always below 60% of the UK average, i.e., Single: £9,500, couple with no kids: £14,200, couple with two kids: £20,400.

default.description: Our household income is always above 60% of the UK average, i.e., Single: £9,500, couple with no kids: £14,200, couple with two kids: £20,400.

enum.description: Our household income is stable.
Our household income doesn’t change that much.
Our household income always goes up and down and we can’t plan ahead.

default.description: Our household income is stable.

enum.description: In our household everyone has good credit scores; we can borrow money from a bank.
Someone in our household has bad credit scores; borrowing money can be a problem because we don’t know how to get good advice.
In our household we can’t get credit or any proper help to get some; we borrow from loan sharks.

default.description: In our household everyone has good credit scores; we can borrow money from a bank.

enum.description: We save and we can cope with emergencies; we have at least 3 months of expenses set aside. We don’t have a lot of debt.
We have some money to save, but we can’t save too often because debt and bills are hard to cope with.
In our household we don’t have money to save, or for emergencies. We have lots of debt and can’t keep up with our bills.

default.description: We save and we can cope with emergencies; we have at least 3 months of expenses set aside. We don’t have a lot of debt.

description.es: We have more than one source of income

enum.description: In our household more than one person has a job, or the only person who works has a secure job.
In our household only one person has a job, but the income from it isn’t secure. Or, our second-income source is unreliable or comes from benefits.
No one has a job in our household, or our income is not fixed. We rely on benefits.

default.description: In our household more than one person has a job, or the only person who works has a secure job.

enum.description: We all have proper ID. We have things like birth certificates and drivers’ licences to show, if asked.
Someone in our household has ID problems; we can find ways to sort it.
Someone in our household does not have/has a problem with proper ID. We don’t know how to/can’t afford to fix it.

default.description: We all have proper ID. We have things like birth certificates and drivers’ licences to show, if asked.

enum.description: We can rent long-term,   or we own our property. We are happy with our rental contract and can move somewhere else if we want to.
We are unhappy with our current rental contract, or we might have to move. We might not be able to stay in our home because we can’t afford it.
We have slept somewhere that is not our home for one night or more in the last year; or we live in a temporary place; or we fear eviction; or we had to leave our home without wanting to.

default.description: We can rent long-term,   or we own our property. We are happy with our rental contract and can move somewhere else if we want to.

enum.description: In our household our basic appliances work. We have a fridge, freezer, washing machine, cooker, etc.
In our household some basic appliances are faulty or broken.
In our household we can’t often use/don’t have basic appliances.

default.description: In our household our basic appliances work. We have a fridge, freezer, washing machine, cooker, etc.

description.es: We have proper facilities to prepare food

enum.description: We have a proper kitchen with everything to cook and store food for our household.
Our kitchen isn’t bad, but we need to fix things or get more stuff to cook properly.
We do not have a proper place to cook. We have to cook somewhere else or share a crowded space.

default.description: We have a proper kitchen with everything to cook and store food for our household.

enum.description: We can afford to pay for gas and/or electricity all of the time.
We have gas and/or electricity, but we can’t use it all the time because of the cost.
In the past year, sometimes there has been no gas or electricity and we have had to choose between cooking or heating.

default.description: We can afford to pay for gas and/or electricity all of the time.

enum.description: Our house is very safe. There are no broken appliances, structural damage, loose wiring or damp. Doors and windows lock; the building withstands all weather conditions.
Our house has a few safety issues that may be bad for those living there, e.g.: windows let in the cold; risk of flooding.
Our house is in bad condition. People who live there are at risk because of, e.g.: damp or mould, heavy-rain flooding, doors and windows don’t lock properly.

default.description: Our house is very safe. There are no broken appliances, structural damage, loose wiring or damp. Doors and windows lock; the building withstands all weather conditions.

enum.description: In our house we always have access to a bathroom which has got good ventilation, hot- and cold-running water,  privacy and is cleaned often.
In our house we share the bathroom with 4 or more people, and/or the bathroom is not regularly cleaned or is defective.
In our house we do not always have access to a bathroom, and/or our bathroom is in a bad state.

default.description: In our house we always have access to a bathroom which has got good ventilation, hot- and cold-running water,  privacy and is cleaned often.

enum.description: In our house adults, teens and kids do not sleep in the same bedrooms; the house is not overcrowded. Everyone has their privacy.
In our house adults, teens and kids sleep in the same bedrooms; some people in our house want more space or privacy.
In our house many people sleep in the same bedroom. Adults, teens and kids share bedrooms with each other. Our house is overcrowded and we need more space.

default.description: In our house adults, teens and kids do not sleep in the same bedrooms; the house is not overcrowded. Everyone has their privacy.

description.es: We have the furniture we need

enum.description: In our house we have enough space to work and relax in. We have enough furniture and appliances to be comfortable.
Our house is quite comfortable,  but we could do with better furniture and appliances, or the house is too messy to relax in.
We do not have enough furniture or appliances to live comfortably. There is not enough living/eating room or proper facilities to relax with.

default.description: In our house we have enough space to work and relax in. We have enough furniture and appliances to be comfortable.

description.es: We have access to good transportation

enum.description: To get to the places we often go, we have our own transport (car, motorcycle, bicycle); or we have good access to public transport.
To get to the places we go often, transport isn’t always handy, or costs too much. Sometimes we can’t find the money to get about.
We don’t have our own transport and public transport in our area is unreliable, e.g. a bus now-and-then that costs too much.

default.description: To get to the places we often go, we have our own transport (car, motorcycle, bicycle); or we have good access to public transport.

description.es: We can access the shops we need

enum.description: We can always reach the shops and services we need, e.g.: food and hardware shops, hairdressers, banks etc.
Sometimes going shopping is difficult, e.g.: too expensive, shops are far away, carrying heavy bags is a chore, etc.
A lot of the time we can’t go shopping, e.g., shops are far away, too expensive, carrying heavy bags is a chore, etc.

default.description: We can always reach the shops and services we need, e.g.: food and hardware shops, hairdressers, banks etc.

description.es: We have a phone and internet access

enum.description: Adults in our household have affordable mobile phones and internet access.
In our household we have mobile phones and/or the internet, but we can’t always afford them.
In our household we don’t have a mobile phone or the internet.

default.description: Adults in our household have affordable mobile phones and internet access.

description.es: We feel safe where we live and work

enum.description: We feel safe where we live and work.
We don’t feel safe either where we live or where we work.
We don’t feel safe where we work and live.

default.description: We feel safe where we live and work.

description.es: We have the clothing we need

enum.description: In our household everyone has proper clothes and shoes for all conditions/needs e.g. for work.
Our household has enough clothes and shoes, but we don’t always have proper clothing, e.g. work. We have winter clothes, but need more.
In our household we do not have proper clothes or shoes, especially for winter. We often depend on donations.

default.description: In our household everyone has proper clothes and shoes for all conditions/needs e.g. for work.

enum.description: We have good insurance and it covers all possible risks.
We have some insurance, but we aren’t sure if it covers everything, or it doesn’t offer the best protection.
We don’t have proper/any insurance.

default.description: We have good insurance and it covers all possible risks.

enum.description: In our household we always have enough to eat.
In our household we sometimes battle to buy enough food for our needs.
People in our household have had fewer than two meals a day, or have gone hungry in the past few months because we can’t afford food.

default.description: In our household we always have enough to eat.

enum.description: We know what a healthy diet is and we eat healthy food.
We get confused about how to eat healthy or can’t afford to buy healthy food. We aren’t sure if our diet is healthy or not.
We don’t know or think about healthy eating and our diet does not usually include fruit or vegetables.

default.description: We know what a healthy diet is and we eat healthy food.

description.es: We have access to health care

enum.description: Everyone in the house has a local GP and is happy to use this service when needed.
In our household everyone has a GP, but some of us don’t always go to the doctor when we should.
Someone in our household hasn’t got a local GP or doesn’t go to the doctor when sick.

default.description: Everyone in the house has a local GP and is happy to use this service when needed.

description.es: We keep a good level of hygiene

enum.description: We keep clean all the time by washing hands, bathing and brushing teeth daily.
Sometimes we can’t take baths or we don’t wash our hands or brush our teeth daily.
Not everyone in our household keeps clean. Sometimes we can’t afford basic toiletries like soap and toothpaste.

default.description: We keep clean all the time by washing hands, bathing and brushing teeth daily.

enum.description: All members of the household understand sexual health and family-planning, and use contraceptives like condoms and the pill.
Members of the household understand sexual health and family-planning, but take risks. They can get contraceptives like condoms and the pill, but don’t always use them.
Members of the household don’t know about sexual health and family-planning and can’t get contraceptives like condoms and the pill.

default.description: All members of the household understand sexual health and family-planning, and use contraceptives like condoms and the pill.

description.es: We have good eyesight or glasses

enum.description: No one in the household has eye problems that aren’t seen to; everyone goes for check-ups every 2 years.
A member of the household with an eyesight problem hasn’t been for an eye check-up in the last 3 years. This person knows how to get support.
A member of the household hasn’t gone for an eye check-up in more than 5 years; glasses are needed but cost too much. There is no support for this problem.

default.description: No one in the household has eye problems that aren’t seen to; everyone goes for check-ups every 2 years.

enum.description: In our household  everyone visits a dentist regularly.
Someone in our household has not been to the dentist in the past 5 years.
In our household someone needs to see a dentist but can’t/doesn’t know how to, or can’t pay for it.

default.description: In our household  everyone visits a dentist regularly.

description.es: We are up to date with vaccinations

enum.description: In our household everyone has had all their vaccinations. They know how this will keep them healthy.
In our household we need vaccine boosters, or choose not to vaccinate.
In our household there are people who haven’t been vaccinated or aren’t sure if they have been or not.

default.description: In our household everyone has had all their vaccinations. They know how this will keep them healthy.

enum.description: We use all the rubbish-removal services, including pay-to-collect for bulky items. We can recycle at the neighbourhood recycling centre.
Our household has rubbish bins, but they aren’t used properly. The rubbish-removal system is bad and pay-to-collect bulky items cost too much.
Our household doesn’t have/doesn’t use a household/common rubbish bin. Rubbish isn’t often collected.

default.description: We use all the rubbish-removal services, including pay-to-collect for bulky items. We can recycle at the neighbourhood recycling centre.

description.es: Our neighbourhood is free of pollution

enum.description: Our neighbourhood is always clean, free from, e.g.: dog dirt, litter in the street or bad air quality.
Our neighbourhood is clean, but not always. The air quality isn’t great.
Our household environment is dirty, e.g., dog waste, litter in the streets, bad air quality. It is a health hazard, or it has already affected our health.

default.description: Our neighbourhood is always clean, free from, e.g.: dog dirt, litter in the street or bad air quality.

description.es: We can read and write in English

enum.description: Everyone in our household can read and write English well, including writing for work purposes.
Everyone in our household can read and write English well, but need help with harder writing tasks or reading.
Some members of our household don’t read and write English well enough.

default.description: Everyone in our household can read and write English well, including writing for work purposes.

title.es: Children Enrolled in and Attending School

enum.description: All members in our household finished school and all kids will get their GCSEs. Anyone 16-18 is either in   school/college or an apprenticeship/traineeship.
Some in our household might not finish school or get a minimum of C in English /Maths GCSEs, or won’t finish school, college or an apprenticeship/traineeship.
There are children in our household who aren’t in school and should be.16-18-year olds aren’t in school or college or in any training, e.g. for an apprenticeship.

default.description: All members in our household finished school and all kids will get their GCSEs. Anyone 16-18 is either in   school/college or an apprenticeship/traineeship.

title.es: Knowledge and Skills to Generate Income

description.es: We know how to get a job or make money

enum.description: Everyone in our household has the skills and knows how to find employment or start a business.
People in our household have some skills to get employment, but struggle with, e.g., application forms, interview skills.
Some adults in our household have no skills to get employment, start a business, or have never worked.

default.description: Everyone in our household has the skills and knows how to find employment or start a business.

enum.description: We have a household budget and stick to it.
There is a household budget, but sometimes we spend too much.
In our household we struggle with money, or we live on next to nothing.

default.description: We have a household budget and stick to it.

enum.description: We mix with many people who are a good influence on us. We use these connections to open up   opportunities.
We mix with people, but we don't make the most of it.
In our household we don’t mix much and those people we know have a bad influence on some of us.

default.description: We mix with many people who are a good influence on us. We use these connections to open up   opportunities.

enum.description: In our household kids have all the uniforms, school supplies/books needed.
In our household kids have basic uniforms and school supplies, but we can’t afford anything extra.
In our household kids don’t have the school supplies they need or they aren’t good enough.

default.description: In our household kids have all the uniforms, school supplies/books needed.

enum.description: We can get information from different media for both news and entertainment.
We can get information, but not always. We use the access we have for entertainment rather than the news.
We don’t get or get very little news and entertainment.

default.description: We can get information from different media for both news and entertainment.

enum.description: We regularly take part in neighbourhood leisure activities, as well as elsewhere. We have all we need to join in and we can afford it.
We sometimes take part in leisure activities in our neighbourhood, or we quit because it costs too much.
We don’t take part in leisure activities outside of our household.

default.description: We regularly take part in neighbourhood leisure activities, as well as elsewhere. We have all we need to join in and we can afford it.

enum.description: Our household keeps and knows social traditions, and we fit in well with others.
Our household sort of fits in with others, but we sometimes feel cut off.
In our household we don’t fit in with others.

default.description: Our household keeps and knows social traditions, and we fit in well with others.

enum.description: All of our household accepts and respects cultural differences; they treat everyone the same.
Some of our household does not accept or respect differences; they treat people unfairly if their ideas, religion, race or sexual choices are different.
Most of our household doesn’t accept or respect differences; they treat people unequally.

default.description: All of our household accepts and respects cultural differences; they treat everyone the same.

enum.description: In our household we know our rights and we feel we are respected.
In our household most of us know our rights, but feel like we may be put down or treated badly.
In our household we aren’t sure about our rights. We feel put down and/or treated badly.

default.description: In our household we know our rights and we feel we are respected.

description.es: We are actively involved in [groups] group-participation

enum.description: Everyone in our household joins in groups where they can give and feel support.
Only sometimes those in our household attend groups, but they aren’t well connected in these.
Some in our household don’t belong to any group, e.g. in the neighbourhood, church, committees, parenting or social.

default.description: Everyone in our household joins in groups where they can give and feel support.

enum.description: In our household we know who to talk to, to sort problems in our community, e.g. local MP/councillors, or starting a petition.
In our household we don’t try to sort problems in our community. We only do so if someone else takes the lead.
In our household we don’t know how to get in touch with the local authorities, or we don’t bother  because nothing ever happens if we do.

default.description: In our household we know who to talk to, to sort problems in our community, e.g. local MP/councillors, or starting a petition.

enum.description: Everyone in our household is registered to vote and always does.
Everyone in our household is registered to vote, but doesn’t always.
In our household no one is registered to vote, or we can’t be bothered to vote.

default.description: Everyone in our household is registered to vote and always does.

enum.description: When we see problems around us, we sort them out positively.
When we see problems around us we usually don’t do anything, or we try to fix them but aren’t really sure how to do it.
In our household we avoid problems and wait for others to sort them.

default.description: When we see problems around us, we sort them out positively.

description.es: We know how to plan for the future

enum.description: In our household we often think of ways to change our circumstances. We have real targets for the future, and know how to achieve them.
In our household we think about what we want in the future, but aren’t sure how to get there.
In our household we don’t see the point in trying to change anything.

default.description: In our household we often think of ways to change our circumstances. We have real targets for the future, and know how to achieve them.

enum.description: Most, or all of the household, are really confident and secure in many different situations.
Some, but not all of the household, are confident and secure; we aren’t that happy leaving our comfort zone.
Most of our household is insecure; we don't leave our comfort zone.

default.description: Most, or all of the household, are really confident and secure in many different situations.

description.es: We consider others when making decisions

enum.description: Our household makes decisions that respect the family and the community.
Our household makes decisions that are in line with the local community but are not necessarily our own.
The household only does what suits it and doesn’t care how that affects others.

default.description: Our household makes decisions that respect the family and the community.

enum.description: Those in our household read their and other peoples’ emotions well. They react well in many different situations and understand how their actions affect themselves and others.
Our household can sometimes read their emotions or those of others well, and know how to react. If there is stress or a problem, though, they might act without thinking or withdraw.
People in our household do things without thinking of the consequences to themselves or to others.

default.description: Those in our household read their and other peoples’ emotions well. They react well in many different situations and understand how their actions affect themselves and others.

enum.description: Our household has a good opinion of itself. We are confident in the way we come across. We like to dress well and look good, and like it when others do too.
Some household members like the way others express themselves, but don’t feel confident to do the same, or feel self-conscious when dressing differently.
Most household members don’t have a good opinion of themselves, nor do they like to dress well or look good; they don’t care whether others do either.

default.description: Our household has a good opinion of itself. We are confident in the way we come across. We like to dress well and look good, and like it when others do too.

title.es: Readiness/Desire to Develop Skills and Knowledge

description.es: We look to learn new skills

enum.description: In our household we are always looking to learn or to better our skills.
Some of us are interested in new skills and knowledge, but don’t often look for chances to find these or can’t.
Our household isn’t interested in new skills and knowledge.

default.description: In our household we are always looking to learn or to better our skills.

description.es: We don't have violence in our house

enum.description: Physical, sexual, economic or emotional abuse isn’t a problem in our household.
In our household there has been some physical, sexual, economic or emotional abuse; it has been sorted.
In our household there is physical, sexual, economic or emotional abuse; nothing has been done about it.

default.description: Physical, sexual, economic or emotional abuse isn’t a problem in our household.

enum.description: In our household we have goals and we know how to achieve them.
In our household we have some goals, but can’t always achieve them.
In our household we don’t have goals, or want any change.

default.description: In our household we have goals and we know how to achieve them.

description.es: We know how to make decisions

enum.description: In our household we all have a say and make decisions. Everyone can make decisions for themselves.
Only some members of our household take charge; they don’t listen to others even when things affect others directly.
In our household only one person is in charge of everything.

default.description: In our household we all have a say and make decisions. Everyone can make decisions for themselves.
